title: Group access to subscription
content:
When you submit a request based on a cloud offering or modify an existing cloud subscription, you can enable group access to subscription on the request. This opens the possibility to assign your groups to the subscription as well. If the groups are assigned to the subscriptions under different access levels, all members of those groups will be able to operate, modify, cancel or have full access to that subscription according to the assigneed access level. The initial requestor person will stay as the subscriber of the subscription.

Enable group access to subscription

In Service Portal, when you submit a request based on a cloud offering or modify an existing cloud subscription, you can turn on Enable group access to subscription to define the group access, including Full access,  Operate subscription, Modify subscription and Cancel subscription. 

  • When the Enable group access to subscription option is Off, only the subscriber has full access (operate, modify and cancel) to the cloud subscription. 
  • When the Enable group access to subscription option is On, the cloud subscription can be accessed by the subscriber and the users in the configured groups. You can select multiple groups for each access level to define the access control for the subscription.
    • Full access - All users in the groups are granted with rights to operate, modify and cancel this subscription. The Manage service instance, Modify subscription and Cancel subscription options will be available when the users access this subscription.
    • Operate subscription - All users in the groups are granted with rights to operate this subscription. The Manage service instance option will be available when the users access this subscription.
    • Modify subscription - All users in the groups are granted with rights to modify this subscription. The Modify subscription option will be available when the users access this subscription.
    • Cancel subscription - All users in the groups are granted with rights to cancel this subscription. The Cancel subscription option will be available when the users access this subscription.
    Note:
    • When you select the Enable group access to subscription option to On, you must add at least one group under any of the access levels.
    • When you add groups, you can only select the groups which include you as a member. 
    • When Enable group access to subscription is On:
      • If the subscriber isn't included in any of the configured groups, the subscriber will only have view access to the cloud subscription.
      • ​​​​​​​If the subscriber is included in the configured groups, the subscriber will have same access with the configured groups.
    • In Service Portal > Services and Assets > Subscriptions tab, the accessible subscriptions will be displayed in the subscription list based on the selected owner from the Owner list.
